snippet: Under the $25 billion national mortgage settlement intended to help at-risk homeowners, more gave up their homes in short sales than stayed in their homes through debt reduction.
abstract: Report by banking monitor Joseph A Smith Jr says $25 billion national mortgage settlement, intended to help homeowners affected by housing crisis, appears to be running ahead of schedule; notes number of households helped by settlement has fallen short of original predictions; critics complain too much relief has been given to people who gave up their homes in short sales and not enough to help those who retain their homes.
lead_paragraph: Under the $25 billion national mortgage settlement intended to help at-risk homeowners, more gave up their homes in short sales than stayed in their homes through debt reduction.

headline.main: Settlement Report Finds Banks Giving Timely Mortgage Relief
headline.print_headline: Settlement Report Finds Banks Giving Timely Mortgage Relief
